summary:
Catwoman Soulstealer
Author: Sarah J. Maas
Genre: Fantasy
Pages: 384
Rating: 5/5
Trailer:
Quotations:
She was a ghost. A...
body:
Catwoman Soulstealer

Author: Sarah J. Maas

Genre: Fantasy

Pages: 384

Rating: 5/5

Trailer:

Quotations:

  • She was a ghost. A wraith.
  • Don’t ever touch me again.
  • Let the bloodying begin.
  • Undefeated.

Spoiler-free Review:

So let me just start by saying that Sarah J. Maas has been getting a lot of negativity these days. — I have no idea why — But it made me hesitate a bit before picking up this book, however Sarah (like always) made me feel like an absolute idiot for doubting my favourite author even for a second. Because, my dear friend, this book is amazing!

Selina Kyle is the icon this generation needed. Period. End of the discussion.

Sarah did such an amazing job in this book: there was diversity and metal illness was discussed so well. — All of our main characters have gone through a lot, and it would not be wrong to say that the book is bleeding with some really impactful heart wrecking moments.

One of my favourite aspects of the novel was the girl gang Selina Kyle forms with Poison Ivy and Harley Quinn and the hiest they pull off together. — Downright extraordinary writing by the author, because instead of telling us, Sarah shows us how the hiest is pulled off and the escapes are made. The amount of action we are given is insane!

Unpopular opinion: I loved Poison Ivy more than Harley.

Sarah also touched upon Quinn’s relationship with the Joker which I wasn’t expecting. It didn’t completely take over the story obviously but she gave the gist of it, enough for you to understand if you aren’t familiar with their relationship in the comics. — I am not a Harley Quinn and The Joker shipper, so yikes.

(I shipped Quinn and Ivy 💜)

Talking about ships, let’s get to Selina Kyle’s counterpart, a.k.a. Batwing/Luke Fox!

I loved Luke.

And I was not expecting to love him!

We have both Selina’s and Luke’s prespective and I really loved them both.

Having both their perspectives made the book so much more interesting, as we had two people from completely different backgrounds but who had similar values and ideals. They just had different ways of going about achieving those values.

As you cone to the ending — the most beautiful fifty pages — you realize that all the bad stuffs Selina has done throughout has been for one reason only and it’s so beautiful.

It was so heart wrecking and amazing and you realise how misunderstood she is. For all her plotting and planning, all her villainous actions, she is actually trying to do a good thing and she will resort to any means possible to get it done.

And by the end, everyone finally sees her for who the kind soul she is.

It was such a perfect way to end this book and I felt so satisfied and happy.

By the way of conclusion I’d like to say that this book is a masterpiece and Sarah J. Maas is a genius.

summary: I am beyond thrilled that I signed up for the Now in Books subscription box! First, I received a SIGNED copy of Sarah J. Maas’...
body:
I am beyond thrilled that I signed up for the Now in Books subscription box! First, I received a SIGNED copy of Sarah J. Maas’ Catwoman: Soulstealer!

I must say that I adore Maas’ cool author signature!

As an aside, I made it my life’s mission while growing up to perfect my own signature – to make it unique.

Now, I feel as though my signature always varies. I wonder if authors and celebrities in general practice their signatures?

Other than the sweet surprise of a signed – much-anticipated by moi – book, the box includes a playlist inspired by the story, which I think is absolutely genius and amazing!

Although I have a tough time listening to tunes while reading, I’m really looking forward to sampling the playlist – when I’m NOT reading! 😀

I’m so glad I checked out the book without its jacket – so purple and pretty! Plus, I adore the Catwoman figure, which is all that adorns the purple background.

Additionally, I love, love, love the saying on the bookmark included – “When the bat’s away, the cat will play.”!

Overall, I am incredibly pleased with my rookie box! I went wild and subscribed to seemingly 50 bookish boxes! LOL! Therefore, I will have plenty of Unboxed posts coming up! 😀

Love, Maggie

Catting Around I am beyond thrilled that I signed up for the Now in Books subscription box! First, I received a SIGNED copy of Sarah J.

Love, Maggie

blog.title: The.Bookish.Fangirl
blog.description:
My old username: Booklion12
I'm a bookworm who is also obsessed with music and loves to sing. I'm an obsessive fangirl: more specifically about Young Adult and New Adult books, but sometimes Taylor Swift, Teen Wolf, Marvel movies, etc. P.S. If anyone ever needs to get something off their chest or just needs to talk, I'm all ears :)

summary: Throne Of Glass 📚, a playlist by Cassidy Novotny on Spotify
body:
Throne Of Glass 📚, a playlist by Cassidy Novotny on Spotify

Throne Of Glass playlist!

I’m really proud of this one guys, and I think you’ll find it reminds you of the series when you listen to it! I’m also open to suggestions, I personally listen to this playlist all the time right now as I’m reading it and even when I’m not!

blog.name: thereyouareivebeenlookingforyou
blog.title: "You look good with wings," he said.

tags: a court of frost and starlight
a court of frost and starlight cover
summary: “The Winter Solstice. In a week. I was still new enough to being High Lady that I had no idea what my formal role was to be. If...
text:
“The Winter Solstice. In a week. I was still new enough to being High Lady that I had no idea what my formal role was to be. If we’d have a High Priestess do some odious ceremony, as Ianthe had done the year before—

A year. Gods, nearly a year since Rhys had called in his bargain, desperate to get me away from the poison of the Spring Court; to save me from my despair. Had he only been a minute later, the Mother knew what would have happened. Where I’d now be.

Snow swirled and eddied in the garden, catching the brown fibers fo the burlap covering the shrubs.

My mate—who had worked so hard and so selflessly, all without hope that I would ever be with him.

We had both fought for that love, bled for it. Rhys had died for it.”
source: A Court of Frost and Starlight, Sarah J. Maas

reblog.comment: A Court of Frost and Starlight, Sarah J. Maas

summary:
I promised myself that I wouldn’t buy new books anymore till I read all the unread books I have.
Well I broke the promise to...
body:
I can’t wait till a Kingdom of Ash is released!

I promised myself that I wouldn’t buy new books anymore till I read all the unread books I have.

Well I broke the promise to myself and just pre-ordered a Kingdom of Ash from Sarah J. Maas.

I’m so excited!

blog.description:
Mary, 30, a lady who has a cottage in a forest and who may or may not be a witch and have the answers to life and everything (lol no, my motto is fake it till you make it). I have loved books ever since I was a little girl. If I could spend my whole day reading, I would. Life unfortunately gets in the way. It's rude, really.

2019 Reading Challenge

Mary has read 3 books toward her goal of 55 books.

summary:
Caitsbooks Reviews: Crown of Midnight by Sarah J. Maas 



Overall: 5/5 Stars Characters: 5/5 Setting: 5/5 Writing: 5/5 Plot and...
caption:
Caitsbooks Reviews: Crown of Midnight by Sarah J. Maas

Overall: 5/5 Stars
Characters: 5/5
Setting: 5/5
Writing: 5/5
Plot and Themes: 5/5
Awesomeness Factor: 5/5
Review in a Nutshell: Crown of Midnight is the perfect sequel, expanding on the epic world of Throne of Glass while giving amazing character development and a gripping plot.

“But death was her curse and her gift, and death had been her good friend these long, long years.”

Blog || Goodreads || Bookstagram || Twitter  || Reviews 

- Premise -

Crown of Midnight follows Celaena Sardothien after the events of Throne of Glass. Celaena has earned her spot as King’s Champion but feels no loyalty toward the cruel King of Ardalan. She continues to try to unravel the secrets that lurk in the glass castle, risking the relationships she’s building and her life.

“Then Celaena and the King of Adarlan smiled at each other, and it was the most terrifying thing Dorian had ever seen.” 


- Setting & Writing -

Each book shows more and more of this fantastic world. Each layer revealed is fascinating and well developed. I’m always surprised by the magic unveiled and how the mysteries are explained. Sarah J. Maas’ voice is absolutely brilliant and she does such a fantastic job of immersing the reader into this elaborate world.

“Some things you hear with your ears. Others, you hear with your heart.” 


- Plot-

The plot of Crown of Midnight is full of mystery, action, and betrayal. There was plenty of action, humor, and romance, and never a dull moment. There are so many twists in this book as well! While some can be a bit predictable (if you read the genre a lot), there is always a refreshing edge to them that still make it exciting. 

“The best lies were always mixed with truth.” 


- Characters - 

I love each and every one of these characters. They remain just as fascinating and multi-faceted as in the first novel, plus their growth in this book is absolutely amazing. The relationships all develop beautifully as well. While I was 100% team Dorian in Throne of Glass, Sarah J. Maas is able to manipulate my emotions so perfectly that I really didn’t mind that Chaol gets the spotlight in this book. But Dorian is still my love and I want to protect him. Speaking of protecting characters- god this book hurt me. From character deaths to relationship deaths, I was a mess the entire time I was reading. But I think that’s why it’s so good- these characters feel so real and human that when anything happens to them, there is no way to detach yourself from them.

“If they wanted Adarlan’s Assassin, they’d get her.
And Wyrd help them when she arrived.”


- Conclusion -

Pros- Fascinating characters, great development, amazing setting & writing
Cons- Why??? Why did this book have to hurt me so much???
Overall- 5/5 stars.
Crown of Midnight is an amazing sequel, that all fans of Throne of Glass need to pick up. Even if you weren’t a fan, still pick it up. It is absolutely amazing.
caption_abstract:
Caitsbooks Reviews: Crown of Midnight by Sarah J. Maas

Overall: 5/5 Stars
Characters: 5/5
Setting: 5/5
Writing: 5/5
Plot and Themes: 5/5
Awesomeness Factor: 5/5
Review in a Nutshell: Crown of Midnight is the perfect sequel, expanding on the epic world of Throne of Glass while giving amazing character development and a gripping plot.

“But death was her curse and her gift, and death had been her good friend these long, long years.”

summary: You make me want to live… Not survive; not exist. Live.
text: You make me want to live… Not survive; not exist. Live.

reblog.comment: Sarah J. Maas, Queen of Shadows

blog.name: morebooks-pls
blog.title: Fiction is Better than Reality
blog.description: Victoria | xxi | Hufflepuff | infj | 🇺🇸🇮🇹 ~~ Currently Reading: Broken Throne (Victoria Aveyard) ~~ Sansa & Arya Stark Stan | Witchlands, Red Queen, ToG, ACOTAR, AIETA, Mara Dyer, CBB, HP, THG, TMI, other amazing books/tv shows/ships

body:
Currently Reading Update

So I finally finished Assassin’s Blade and it took me much longer than it should’ve simply bc I didn’t want to read what was coming (if I never read it, it never happened right?).. I actually forgot “Celaena” didn’t know who betrayed her when she went to Endovier…

Anyway now I’m an emotional wreck and a Sam x Celaena shipper so it’ll be very interesting rereading the main series now. It’ll make the next betrayal to Celaena that much harder…

blog.name: fandomlifeofsara
blog.title: Fandoms💖❤️
blog.description:
Just your friendly neighbourhood fandom blog! Current fandoms:

TOG, ACOTAR, The Grishaverse (Leigh Bardugo), MARVEL, GOT, Legend (Marie Lu) and many more!

Literally just a fan of fantasy and Sci-Fi (and YA-novels). Currently reading: Kingdom of Ash (SO. MUCH. PAIN.) & Luck in the Shadows

Thanks for checking by!
